REVIEW_BODY:
The views of the garden and the supertrees are beautiful. Supertrees look even more beautiful in the night when they light up.

As only limited number of people can go on the skyway at a time you get a queuing slot along with the ticket. On the skyway the coordinators keep asking you to move forward as the bridge needs to be empty before next group of people come in. It took around 10-15 minutes for us to cross the skyway along with taking few pictures.

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome views and Amazing Light Show
REVIEW_BODY: Great place to come with families and to do the skywalk and light show. The skywalk provided us with great view of the bay and the gardens. The light show was amazing and very well done. We really liked it here and there was nothing to wrong about it.

REVIEW_TITLE: doable during daytime; night show a must
REVIEW_BODY: The skyway is located at the site of the gardens by the bay! The evening light n sound show is good else daytime a may be doable thing

An entry fee of $8 and more than an hour of wait is not a fair price of the skywalk. It‚Äôs nothing extraordinarily and I personally preferred the view of supertrees from the ground. Skip it and rather explore gardens by the bay.

We viewed the skyway during the night and came back to go on it during the day. Either way, this takes your breath away! What an amazing structure! It feels really futuristic and magical.
The views from the Skyway are breath taking. Seeing it in pictures is nothing compared to the real experience. The skyway does sway a little so perhaps if you are afraid of heights this might not be for you. However, the feeling you get from just standing on it is worthwhile!

During the night, when it is busy, time spent on it can be limited to 15 minutes. This is not enforced though. When it is not busy, you can spend as much time as you want and take in the experience and feeling that comes with standing on top of such a magical structure while you marvel at the trees.

The tickets can be purchased just beside the skyway and are not expensive.

If you come to Singapore and you do not go on the Skyway, I mean, were you even in Singapore?

Another enjoyable part of our trip to the garden domes. We went on the way on a pretty hot day. It was refreshing to get above the trees into the breeze. They are set up to manage a lot of people (which I assume is the case at sunset). It wasn‚Äôt busy in the middle of the day. Great view of marina bay sands and the domes.
We were lucky enough to get on the skyway a few minutes before the music and light show began and it was quite a wonderful experience.
This attraction has timed tickets. Limited numbers are allowed on the Skyway at each time slot. There is an elevator to the top. Not great for those who don't like heights but a great view.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Vantage Point for view of the Marina Bay landmarks and vicinity
REVIEW_BODY: Elevated bridge offers a fantastic vantage point of the surrounding and landmarks. Easy walk for a surround view.

One of must try attraction when visited Garden by the bay. We can walk from one supertree to others with amazing view. It's a short distance but please take care of your children. At the bridge we can see many of Singapore landmark such as Marina Bay Sand or Singapore Flyer. But if you afraid of heights of have vertigo, just choose another attraction :)
a good place to view the Light and Sound show available every evening free of cost at Garden by the Bay.
Enchanting view of the beautiful skyline of Singapore city ... especially great when coupled with cool weather ... on a suspended walk way
Its a 25 to 30 minutes show in the evening after 7 pm.The show with lights and music is just amazing.
Wait n Watch the Nights and the OCBC skyway to see entire Simgapore . Its simply awesome and what everyone should like.
Waw, you need to see this! The small fee you need to pay is so worth it! Go and explore, enjoy the great views!

If you get a good deal for the OSBC and the park is not packed, then would highly recommend for a different perspective. Really nice views and can get some great pics.
Lining up was a bit of a pain, but kept the skyway less crowded.
We were disappointed that we couldn't go up on the Skyway because you need to buy the tickets way before the light show as they quickly run out.

Up close to the Super Trees, it is a different experience to see the super tree grove from up above. For an Extra $8, you can take an elevator to go up the skyway and get a birds eye view of the super tree grove as well as the surroundings.

The Skyway serves two purposes - get a closer view of the super trees and the surroundings and for many people - most importantly provide multiple photo opportunities.

Tip: Queue up at the ticketing kiost around 7:15pm and get on top by about 7:40pm to enjoy the light show from the top of the bridge. Note that the number of people on top is limited, so depending on the number of people, the queuing time differs
Don't miss this garden lighted area with spectacular "supertrees". It is located near the city center and the equally spectacular hotel with at "ship" on top. Also, very near the Merlion park area.
This skyway walk is surprisingly high and affords great vies of the gardens, Flyer and Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Not expensive and worth the time.

Our daughter and I went up on the Skyway - terrifying if you don't like heights (they do warn you of this). I don't do heights and became scared about half way around BUT the view from up there is magic. You really feel like you are up in the trees. The light show (after we came down) was spectacular. Lovely colours and the choreography was well done. Long ques but worth the wait - and they do move reasonably quickly - very orderly.
It was an amazing experience being on the top of the super grove trees. One of a kind and great experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: The skyway is at its best during light show
REVIEW_BODY: It is different experience when you watch the free light show in evening from skyway. Since it is the busy time you will be in a big queue. Plan accordingly.
I really love this place. This is perfect for family and friend. Even my three-year-old daughter was very happy to appreciate the surroundings and the light show.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you like the Supertree Grove, don‚Äôt skip this
REVIEW_BODY:
Yes, the Skyway is basically just a walking bridge from one supertree to another but there‚Äôs a cool sci-fi feel to it and the view is fascinating. Of course the supertree structures are artificial and all that but the Skyway kind of plays along and adds another angle to this otherworldly location. Fear of heights may be a problem here, though.
On a February Sunday the queues were rather minimal.

Only cost $8 to walk up here. Go early to avoid crowds and heat. Get timed on the walkway but you have plenty of time. Great views out over Marina bay and the gardens. The maintenance is beautifully done and so clean and tidy. A really nice place to be.
We went on Friday evening to do walk. They sold us 8:20 pm spot tickets around 7:45. We left 8:30 with at least 100 people in front of us.
I did not know that the skyway is trembling! I mean by walking there you could feel the smalll movements, which kept mee holding the handrails all the time.
highly recommend walking the ocbc skyway, i suggest coming at morning when it opens so there are less crowds and more peaceful

REVIEW_TITLE: Life high up in the (artificial) trees
REVIEW_BODY: Everything about and in the Gardens by the Bay is well thought out and spectacular. This walkway winds its way around the tops of the Supertree Grove being suspended in the trees themselves. Can get very busy so add a little time.

I always expect to pay to see things but I am not so sure why, when we were there, so many people thought they should head on up for free. It is worth the small entrance fee to walk among the treetops
Very affordable and great views from above. A good 30-minute walk from one end to another. Would recommend

If you opt to pay the $8 to do this, go early as the walk is relatively short, the skyway is narrow and suspended by cables so it sways slightly as you walk on it. There is also invariably someone taking a picture which impedes your walk, in general, the concept of the skywalk is intriguing but there was something lacking in the overall execution of it. Save your $8 and check out Satay by the Bay instead.

The only complaint I had about this walkway was that it was too short and the experience was over too quickly. At S$8 it was worth every cent. The walkway swayed a bit due to the reasonably fresh wind, which only added to the experience. The view back to Marina Bay high rise contrasted to the enormous expanse of green which really showcased what Singapore is about, a modern city which is highly environmentally conscious. I would recommend anyone visiting Gardens by the Bay to include the Skyway in their visit, despite the additional cost.
The OCBC skyway has an amzing view. Rain may cause a hindrance to your travel plans, so you must check the weather before planning. The cost is extra apart from the entrance ticket to the gardens.

If you're in Singapore and you need a 'trophy shot' for your instagram, this is probably the place to be. If you're into artificial giant trees, you'd be surrounded by 18 of them. In the background - Marina Bay Sands with it's giant ship stranded on top of 3 towers, the clam shell / brassiere-inspired Domes, you'd also get the Singapore Flyer thrown in, a great bargain for an $8 entrance fee.
The majestic curved Skyway offers a great 360¬∫ view of Gardens by the Bay.

Go early and avoid getting photobombed.
Not a bad experience at the price it is offered, but you can get better view of the city from other buildings.

One can get a nice view of the Supertree Grove atop OCBC Skyway. One visitor is entitled to be on the skyway for only 15 mins, however, for its length, I find the time adequate.

There's a fee of 8 SGD for the Skyway. Last admission is at 8pm. However, it's not that one gets admission as soon as one buys tickets. Instead, the staff assigns a queuing time i.e. at that particular time (maybe half-an-hour after buying tickets) you need to queue at the lift area.

Frankly speaking, though it is nice to get views of the whole area, but it didn't meet my expectations. Nevertheless, one shouldn't miss it.
There's a great view, and you can see a lot of Singapore from there. It makes a trip to Gardens By The Bay much more interesting.

Man Made beautiful place. You need to buy tickets to go up. There is a lift which can take you up. The walk is beautiful - this is a place for people who love taking pictures. You can truly appreciate the design and the effort by the people to create this place.

The OCBC Skyway is a walkway that is located above the ground and is a great viewing gallery of the surrounding areas of the Gardens by the Bay.

Admission prices are SGD8 for adults - but I question whether an admission charge is really necessary.

It can get quite crowded in the evening when the light show takes place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Kinda cool, visit at night though
REVIEW_BODY:
These false trees are actually kinda cool, and the skyway is an interesting one way walk. The limit is 70 people at any one time, and this is selfie land so lots of phones on stalks.

Tickets are $8/pp, but you can get them on discount so shop around.

Well worth the few $ for thus amazing experience. The views are absolutely spectacular. We visited during the day so there were no queues and we could take our time on the bridge.
Night time is another matter - expect to wait up to 90 minutes to even get up there and you only get 15 mins to look at night as it‚Äôs just so busy.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing views of the super trees
REVIEW_BODY: The super trees were the highlight of our singapore trip as they look amazing and you can get great photos. They look pretty awesome from the ground but for $8 it's worth going up on the skywalk as you see them from a whole different dimension plus with added city views. If you go around sunset be prepared for wait times of about an hour though
Its only 8S$ for this. the walkway between the supertrees give a great view over the park and the city, and the unusual Marina Bay Sands hotel.

One thing is to view the supertrees from ground level up, and another to view it at eye level. On the skyway, you can really appreciate the intricate and artistic design of the supertrees' top/crown. From high above, you can also see the two domes of the garden, the Flyer, and the Marina Bay Sands hotel. It's an amazing view and worth visiting it!
Beware that on a crowded day, they allow people to be there for 15 minutes only.

Ocbc skywayand supertreegrove. beautiful vertical plant displays.Enjoy a birds eye view from 22 mtrs high ocbc skyway walk and enjoy
At night there is light and sound show ,very very spectacular not to be missed. one can sleep on grass in open ground and enjoy the show,of
apprx 15 minutes,not to be missed. must in Singapore visit.
this place is part of Garden by bay .
shows are at 7.45 and 8.45 pm
taxi fare from little india 10 singapore dollars
time of visit appr 3 hrs
Please beware this place closed for 1 day each months. Before go there, check which day on the schedule are closed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Breath-taking Night Views and Great light show.
REVIEW_BODY:
Beautiful, enchanting and a wonderful opportunity to capture some pictures.
OCBC Skyway is a real highlight of any visit to the Gardens by the Bay, but you should aim to visit when it is dark and the artificial trees are lit up with some wonderful lights.
Also try and catch the evening Light and Music show either before you go up or when you are on the Skywalk itself.
The queue to get up to the walk itself is pretty busy, but it does move along.
There are signs that say they try to limit people on the skywalk itself to a maximum of 15 minutes, but I am not sure how they manage to usher people out as there seems to be a continual stream of people visiting the walk, I suspect you can stretch the time on the walk to more than 15 minutes - but 15 minutes is probably enough time to catch the views and any photo opportunities anyway, it is not a long walk.
I found the walk more enjoyable than both Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome.
Do yourself a favour, take a trip up to the Skywalk, it takes less time than visiting the domes.
It gives an amazing view to the evening show here in Garden by the bay but one can also choose to relax on the ground and have a view of it
Nothing special, just a tree bridge between artificial tree groves in gardens by the bay. Don't see what's special.

REVIEW_TITLE: A great place to view the Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Besides the allure of the Structure itself, the skyway provides a more majestic look of the Supertrees and the view of Gardens by the Bay

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Night Views of Gardens by the Bay & Super Trees
REVIEW_BODY: If you are in the Gardens by the Bay area, you must go in the evening so you can enjoy the psychedelic lights and the walk along the OCBC Skyway is really amazing. It offers great views of the garden....

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice walk, good view but not a must do item
REVIEW_BODY:
We went to the gardens by the bay in the evening and spent around 3-4 hours there.
The garden is spectacular and a treat to the eyes. OCBC skyway provides a view of the supertrees from a height but there isn't anything you are missing from the ground as well.
I did take the OCBC skyway but its not a must do item. Also, someone mentioned OCBC skyway are the perfect place to watch the evening light and music show but I disagree. The show looks better from the ground.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth it for some, not for others
REVIEW_BODY: This is ticketed and is just a short walk elevated in the trees. For some it may be worth it, for others not so much. We enjoyed it and can check it off the bucket list...and our 23 month old enjoyed the view from up high!
You just get an elevated view from this , Better to spend entrance at flower dome & specially cloud forest as it has better and higher elevated views though indoor .

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth the fee...if you don't mind heights!
REVIEW_BODY:
Unfortunately I do and this was at that awkward height and I felt very uncomfortable! The rest of the review is my son's! He said the views were wonderful and this was the place to be when the light show is on in the supergrove.

As for me...I didn't see much as I was focused on getting to the end!

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing must see attraction at the Gardens by the Bay!!!
REVIEW_BODY: We totally enjoyed the Gardens by the Bay during our Singapore trip, and the Super Trees. This elevated walkway just makes it that much better. We visited the Super Tree grove three times during our trip. The last time, we went at dusk and paid for the OCBC walkway. After getting our ticket (you pay and enter at one end, and exit at the other), we took the elevator up the first Super Tree to the top. They limit how many can be on the walk at once, so there is sometimes a wait. Once we were up, we took our time to walk the bridge which is all suspended by cables from the trees. There is a time limit of 15 minutes which seems loosely enforced. They do seem to try to move you along, but we had plenty of time for lots of pictures. The view from here is amazing, and especially magical at night with the fabulous lighting. Highly recommended!!!

A great addition to the Gardens by the Bay the skywalk gives a different perspective and allows you to see close up the structure of the Super Trees as well as giving excellent city views. If you try to do it at night there are large queues and your time is managed

Take the MRT to Bayfront and follow the signs for Gardens by the Bay. Once there, there are signs all over the place to the various attractions. We had no queues at all for the OCBC skyway and just went straight up in the lift. The cost is SGD 8 per adult and SGD 5 for children (up to 12 years). They say that you have 15 minutes before they move you along but I'm not sure how this is enforced. The views are great from the walkway and you can time it to go up when the light show starts (7.45pm and 8.45pm) if you like, but I think the views would be better from below for that. The lift is available for coming down too but you can take the stairs if you wish. No worries about vertigo at all on this and I'm a bit scared of heights!

The Skyway is a raised walkway between two of the 'trees' in Gardens by the Bay. Cost is S$8 per adult which gives you 15 minutes on the Skyway. It offers great views over the whole Marina Park and Bayfront area and, given the modest cost, is worth doing.

We went in the morning to avoid the long queues that build up during the afternoon and evening (it closes at 9pm).

REVIEW_TITLE: The OCBC SKYWAY & The SUPER TREE GROVE - Landmark Of Gardens By The Bay, Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
The OCBC SKYWAY is an elevated walkway high up & attached to two of the larger manmade steel "trees" forming the SUPER TREE GROVE at the Gardens By The Bay in Singapore.

The SUPER TREE GROVE is a group of towering futuristic steel "SuperTrees". Each "tree" has various flower plants attached throughput its outer wall & a bunch of facing-upwards umbrella-like "branches" at the top.

The tree-like vertical gardens stretch to heights from 25 to 50 meters (82 to 160 ft). These man-made "trees" are the Gardens‚Äô landmark landscape of Gardens By The Bay.

At night the SuperTrees are the star performing the OCBC Garden Rhapsody Light Show - a fantastic display of light and music.

The OCBC Skyway is for visitors to enjoy a panoramic aerial view of the Gardens. An entrance fee is chargeable to access the OCBC Skyway.

Reached the spot at 7.30 the sound and light show begins at 7.45 for 15 mins and is beautiful with the lights and music . It's a little crowded over the weekend but enough place to stand . Once the show was done we took the skyway ticket and went up . Views are good they let u walk on the Supertree path for 15 mins which is good enough for viewing and taking some pics

The skywalk connects two main tress of the Singapore Supertree Grove. The view from the bridge is awesome at night and it seems like one is hanging midair. The best place to view the light and sound show at the Supertree Grove.

We went here just in time for the lights show. Please do note that you only have 15 minutes on top, so plan your time carefully. The lights show was great, but seeing it at the skyway gives us a different angle on it and it gave us chills. The site was really spectacular.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth the queue - best during the evenings
REVIEW_BODY: Yes, the walkway is short and you're mostly paying for the height and the view. Obviously not for those with a fear of heights because the floor isn't exactly solid but you'll be afforded excellent views. Evenings are best because you might catch a sunset along with the lights. There is a queue on weekends so do come prepared to wait. They do move the people through to avoid congestion and the queue does move fairly quickly.

These gigantic SuperTrees rose 22m from the ground and is connected via a circular and at times narrow sky walkway. You can enjoy a panaromic view of the city lush greenery in the day, and when dusk approach, the captivating Marina Bay skyline gets lighted up and the entire area comes alive during the Garden Rhapsody light and sound show (twice daily).

These futuristic giant trees transport you high up on the air ad you can enjoy an aerial walk which approx 128m long, stopping at various points to take pictures of the bay and lush park beneath. While the view from the top is remarkable, it is even more so when on the ground! That's when you can see how high and majestic these SuperTrees are. It gives you a sense of perspective and you felt that you are transported to a futuristic land, where dinosaurs are expected to appear at any one time!

Note: Photographers: Super wide angles, and tripod, for the fascinating twilight view when the trees lights up and the sky colors deepens in hues of red, orange, purple and pink. You can buy tickets at the foot of the Supertrees itself and entrance is via a elevator just behind the stand. Else, you can make reservations or purchase the tickets together when entering the Gardens by the Bay. You can spend some 30-40 mins just on the skyway (more if you stop for photography at every spot, and you can choose to dine in the fine restaurant located up on the tree too! No pets allowed on the bridge, and children should be supervised at all times.

REVIEW_TITLE: Just a walkway; hope it doesn't rain
REVIEW_BODY:
Given it's just a walkway (and not a very long one at that), S$8 seems a bit steep (tickets can be purchased at the foot of the walkway). You could literally walk at one end to the other in a few minutes. Of course we lingered, admired the views, took photos etc - still, we didn't feel it was of great value.

As it was cloudy when we visited, we were informed that if it rained, we would be asked to come down from the walkway for safety reasons. However, as your tickets are "one use only", you would not be allowed back up. Whilst we can appreciate the safety considerations, not sure if that ticketing policy is reasonable. Staff describing the policy were not very sympathetic.

Further, there was a Christmas Fair when we visited. The Fair was in the same grounds as the supertrees where the walkway is located. In order to access the walkway, you were required to pay for Fair tickets first (even if you only wanted to visit the walkway). Signage was poor - only found this out after some fruitless walking around and asking staff. Fair tickets were not available at the door - you had to go to a ticket booth a good 10-15 minutes walk away (with no guarantee of tickets), buy the tickets online (difficult as a tourist with no internet access), or come again before 3pm (before the Fair opens).

Whilst we appreciated the beauty of the structures and the ingenuity of the designers, overall was rather disappointing.

The best time to be on this observation skyway is in the evening when the lights are on. It might even be worth the while if you are watching the evening sound and light show from here.

Just be careful about the timings as they are very particular in letting you up. The person in charge will not even make a 5 minutes exception. So be on time, and just enjoy the show.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good view; go for the experience
REVIEW_BODY: The tickets are available at the entrance of the skywalk. We took the Gardens by the bay open ticket from Klook but it did not include this. Entrance is 8 SGD per person which can be paid by card. You get uninterrupted view of Marina Bay Sands and Singapore flyer which is quite nice. The skywalk itself is not very high so its not scary at all. It just connects 2 supertrees in the garden. A good experience, costly though.
Its only a short skywalk, not really worth the money. You also have a better view of the light show from down below lying on the grass.

Try to visit in the evening. You may have to wait a bit longer in the queue to go up on the skyway but it's worth waiting. It costs $8 pp. You go up by lift, 32m high and get a great view of downtown Singapore. They say that you only get 15 mins up. At the top you can enjoy the view from the top of the trees which gives you an incredible overview on the gardens, Marina Bay Sands, cloud forest and flower dome.

As I commented in another review posted on the Gardens by the Bay, it is worth getting up on the Skyway to view the gardens from different angles. You take an elevator to go up, and to come down, you have a choice of taking the other elevator or walking down the spiral staircase. We walked down and was able to observe the artificial Supertree in detail from the inside.
After 3 visits, I finally get to go up the skyway. It's an amazing view and love the scenic views. Will love to come again.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic way to experience the Gardens by the Bay lightshow
REVIEW_BODY:
Missed out on the Skyway on our first visit to Gardens by the Bay on a previous trip to Singapore as by the time we finished exploring the domes it was too late (last access is usually around 8.30 pm).

This time we arrived early enough to make sure we could experience the Skyway & hopefully view the light show from on the Skyway. Bought our very reasonably priced tickets (S$8 for adults & S$5 for kids) at 7pm.

Unfortunately even at that time it was an hour plus wait in line to access the Skyway.

Light show from the ground was spectacular nonetheless. The Singapore skyline was spectacular from the rainforest canopy vantage point of the Skyway!

Tip: if you want to watch the 7.45 pm light show from the Skyway - you'll need to get there & get tickets by 6.00-6.30 pm.

Returned to the Skywalk in the evening to experience what Singapore does so well - the sound and light show. We experienced this very popular 20 minute display laying on the ground looking up at the massive Avatar like trees -a very powerful experience - and totally free!

OCBC skyway is not to be missed for a birds eye view of the surrounding gardens and other city landmarks. Entrance to this suspended walkway can be found at the base of one of the super grove tree towers located in the central part of the Gardens of the bay. Cost is. $8per person for a 15 minute trip, and can be easily accessed by all via a lift.
Enjoy the stroll along the walk way and marvel at the engineering and enjoy the skyline,the views and the park below You simple will not be disappointed

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views of Singapore and the Gardens of the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: The skyway is good to do in either daylight or at night. Last entry is 8 pm but then you can see the light and music show from the skyway. We did the skyway in daytime which was warm and humid but the views were worth it. At night we sat under the trees and the skyway to watch the light and music show. Free entry to the gardens but to go up to the skyway it cost S$8
If you have a head for heights.... then this is perfect. Great views from the Skyway...again try to book for the early evening when the lights are at their best.

Despite being told at the mail ticket office that the walkway was closed for maintenance, and signs in the Super Tree grove stating that it was closed due to inclement weather (which while overcast was otherwise rain free), the ticket office at the base of the entry tree was open, and quite willing to sell tickets.
For a relatively inexpensive entry fee, you are treated to a walkway between two of the Super Trees that offer an absolutely spectacular viewing platform from which to sight a panorama of the Gardens by the Bay area (and Singapore Flyer).

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic light and music show in the evening
REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens By the Bay are a place to go to, but in the evening the large artificial trees light up are there is a fantastic light and music show. You have to go up onto the Skyway in the evening to get great night time views of the park and the city.

Be warned, this skyway is high and narrow. The views are amazing though but unfortunately my vertigo got the better of me and I couldn't face walking where the path narrowed considerably so got the lift back down to the ground. If you're ok with heights though, you will love this!

REVIEW_TITLE: Perfect place to watch the Light and Sound show
REVIEW_BODY: It was an amazing feeling to watch the light and sound show through the OCBC Skyway that gives you a closer look of the Supertrees from top and the hanging skyway puts more adventure to that
Very cheap addition to a trip to gardens by the bay and definitely worth it for the views across the bay and the gardens
The light show is not to be missed. Be sure to arrange a visit to the Skyway for a fantastic view of the show and the Singapore skyline.
Offers you the opportunity to get an overview of the gardens and take some fotoshots but very short.

The artifical trees at gardens by the bay are simply unique!! So beautiful!! And the skyway is a path between the streets. Great for photos and viewing. There is a show every night, so you can enter it at the sunset and wait to see the show from teh top.

Please follow @mapamunditravel, and if you find it helpful, please vote as an importante colaborator =) thanks in advance

Well worth $8 for adult ticket. Suggested that you spend 15 mins or so on the walk as they limit the number of people who can use at the same time and you probably don‚Äôt need much longer as the skyway isn‚Äôt that long.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views for a nominally priced ticket
REVIEW_BODY: Great to walk along the SkyWay and view the whole of the gardens and especially the Supertree Grove. Great for pictures during the evening sound and light show and a good place to escape all the crowds watching the show.

There is a nice path high among the supertrees, but I was waiting for some special experience that I missed finally. It is funny walking among tree-tops but that is all. You have a much better view from the Marina Bay Sands hotel's terrace.

Do NOT pay by contactless card at the OCBC Skyway ticketing booth. We think we had our card details stolen there on Sunday morning, 5th May 2019. The girl took our card off us and tapped it on the machine herself, then rested it on top of her own mobile phone while she waited for the tickets to print. I was so worried I took a photo of her but I've cancelled my card now anyway!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great but with a price and be prepared to WAIT.
REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting suspended walkway - not for those with fear of heights for sure. If you can, try to time with one of the light shows - would be cool to be up there during the show: you'd need to get in queue a couple time slots before a show and maybe an hour in advance depending on time of year. Regardless, enjoyable
for an extra $8 you can go up here and i loved it , well worth the effort so make the trip, limited to 70 people at a time so go early to avoid queing
Wonderful views of the gardens, safe lifts up and a good length walkway to view the gardens from the top, cheap.
$8 tickets for a skywalk between the towers. Best to do it in the evening/night and not the daytime as you will get nuked by the sun and be all hot and sweaty!

a wonderful time in singapore seeing these amazing sites these sculptured tree are iconic as every travel magazine /tv programme shows them lite up at night they look amazing we definately will return to Singapore
A lift is available so I was able to enjoy the skyway (I use a Walker & Oxygen). It was another great feature to be able to see these Tower tops so close up and the views were great.
Really great views to be seen from the walkway, which you access for a small fee to ride the lift. It also allows you to see the huge extent of this magnificent park.

Gorgeous views of Marina Bay Sands, Marina Bay, Singapore River from OCBC Skyway. Also, we were there during the light show. So watching the light show from above was spectacular. The only thing that bothered me was the employees were rushing people to keep moving. I wanted to stay there for longer.
So glad we stayed to see this attraction. We didn‚Äôt go up on the Skyway but watch the light show in the evening. Well worth the wait, best light show we have seen. Highly recommend.

Go if you get the chance. The wife and I had the pleasure of the Skyway at night when the light and music show was on. There are some amazing views to be had. Just remember that it's not fixed and does swing a bit as it's suspended. It will be closed if there is any chance of rain.

REVIEW_TITLE: A great view of the famous "Supertree Grove" in the Gardens by the Bay!
REVIEW_BODY: This skyway provided a great view of the World-famous "Supertree Grove", both during the daytime, and at night when they are fully illuminated. If visiting Gardens by the Bay, this should be a must-see item!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great aerial views of the Gardens By the Bay complex.
REVIEW_BODY: This a aerial walkway links some of the structures of Supertree Grove, and offer an elevated view of much of the Gardens By The Bay Area, especially a lot of the gardens and lakes and trees outside the Conservatories. Currently $8 to access by elevator, and well worth it.

My husband has acquired a fear of heights, so I was very pleased that I went alone on this walk. One is able to take amazing photos from the various points around the walk. You get such a different perspective when up so high. the price was $8 pp
Completely optional as price is expensive but watching supertree grooves very closely just do it. This is what you can skip and watch supertrees from the ground at free of cost.
Excellent place to have a feed and watch all of the Garden by the bay lights at night, price expensive but the views are worth every cent

The cost per person is $8 and as they only allow 70 people at a time to be on the Skyway there may be a wait. It is a walkway between two of the supertrees and gives you a different aspect to the whole experience of Gardens in the Bay. Great views from up there and, if you are lucky, you could time your walk when one of the two light shows are on in the evening

We bought tickets for the OCBC Skyway in advance from voyagin, along with tickets for the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest for 20% off. Considering all three are pricey, it was a great idea to get the discounted tickets.
We arrived around noon, and we were worried that it'd be really hot on the skyway, but it turned out that it was the opposite and there was a cool breeze along with spectacular views. Because they only let a few people at a time onto the Skyway, it wasn't crowded at all, we could get all the photos we wanted, and the great views weren't obstructed at all.
Later in the evening, the lineups for the skyway get REALLY long, and everyone wants to be on the skyway for the evening light show so the best time to go is in the morning or afternoon when you can walk straight on to the elevator.

Find this review helpful? Give it a thumbs up!
Amazing walkway which gets you up close and personal to the trees. Brilliant views of the gardens - there is a small charge but definitely worth it.

I was up here with my girlfriend, who is not a lover of heights. This is an other perspective of the fake trees but all you get is a little claustrophobic and a view of a restaurant you wished you‚Äôd eaten in. Feel free to pass if you are pressed for time and money.
Visit during the day to see the sites and second visit to view the light show given each evening. Modest entry fee
Don‚Äôt try this if you have a fear of heights.. one gets great views over the gardens and you can get some great pictures. Well worth the $8 charge
Don‚Äôt try this if you have a fear of heights..great views over the gardens and you can get some great pictures. Well worth the $8 charge

It us expensive for what you get. It does give a great view of the area and buildings near by . we didn't know you can only stay a short time and couldn't stay another 15 minutes to see the light show. They hustle you off the walkway.
Waste of money in my opinion, long queues and views were ok but far too expensive for what you actually get. The walkway is a bit wobbly also

We were in line a bit before 9:00am and were the first in line.

I suffer from vertigo and a fear of heights but neither were triggered by the skywalk. Quite breezy the morning we visited but the movement was subtle and not disturbing.

They only allow a certain number of people on the skyway, so never felt crowded.

OCBC SKYWAY is one of the good spot to see the singapore view. The fresh singapore air and the breath taking view releases my stress from all walking in singapore. But take note this is not for those people who have fear of heights because when the weather is windy the bridge really swing hardly. But for those brave heart you can take the risk.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful at night when the light show is on.
REVIEW_BODY: We tried to get onto the actual skywalk but the queue was huge and not prepared to wait the hour time given for tickets. Did purchase tickets once on a previous trip during the day but before we could go up a storm (frequent in Singapore) threatened and the walkway was immediately closed for safety reasons (i.e. rain and lightning strikes). Our money was refunded. There's always next time as we are regular visitors to Singapore

This one‚Äôs superb.
We went at night but it‚Äôs way too crowded since everyone was waiting for the illumination,
the following day we went over in the afternoon and it was a perfect time to explore
and take pictures
S$8 for 15 mins fee is totally worth it.
To those afraid of heights,i recommend that you stay on the grounds because the pathway/bridge, of the skyway gets a little shaky while walking.
Gives you nice elevated view of the Gardens for a modest cost and should be incorporated in your visit. It is a walk with elevator at either end

Sky way walk on the bridge between Tree Groves. It has 8 $ ticket to walk on the bridge but we already seen views from the doom in the Gardens by the Bay. One major attraction is light and sound show.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views but over too quick
REVIEW_BODY: Only $8 and the views are worth it, but I was ushered along a bit too quick. You go up one tower and walk along to the next where you descend. It would be awkward to reverse and go back so it does feel a bit rushed. Advice then is to take your time, let others past and enjoy the views.
its nice to witness "dancing" color effects in tune with our favorite Christmas songs. cant blame for people to wait hours just to witness the light show.

Considering I am a bit afraid of heights it wasnt the best choice for me, but enjoyed it all the same. Happened to be up there during the light show, soooo nice!Costs 8 dollars, but has such long queues. Very well organized , they ask you to get visiting time on your ticket!
The skyway around the supertrees was awesome! Great views over the Gardens by the Bay, also good spot for pics of the Marina Bay Sands.
A must do in Singapore! We went up during the day but the views at night would be amazing too. Just beware the queues can be quite long
It was a superlative experience light and sound show at the super tree grove if you are viewing it from the skywalk. In June the show was around 19.45 to 20.00. Fortunately, we were there.
lovely light show on the huge trees, thoroughly enjoyed our evening walk around here, the views were amazing

Personally this wasn‚Äôt worth the time as the views are nice but you don‚Äôt achieve the best views that other places provide. I would definitely say to visit this place as soon as it opens as the lines get very long. For $8 it‚Äôs pretty cheap to give this a go.

I would definitely recommend this skyway. You can great take pictures and it costs 8SGD per adult and children between the age 3-12 it‚Äôs 5SGD.
You get great views of the Marina Bay sands hotel and of the park.
It‚Äôs quite high up so anybody with a fear of heights should avoid.
If it‚Äôs raining they tend to stop entry into the skyway until the weather becomes better.
Definitely worth the admission charge while your doing the Garden by the bay experience. You will have the opportunity to take some fantastic photos
Didn't think the wait for the lifts was really worth it! Good views but too busy really, were going to go to the cafe but decided against it due to the volume of people.

The Skywalk, Cloud Dome and Flower Dome are all excellent. The Flower Dome has an extremely attractive Christmas display at the moment, Disney themed. The Cloud Dome is brilliant, very clever and very illuminating we found it very interesting. The Skywalk is amazing, to be up at the level of the rain forest canopy and see everything is fabulous.
Don‚Äôt go to Singapore and miss this off your itinerary.

There is a nominal fee to enter theOCBC Skyway, but this keeps numbers down. The bridge is suspended on cables and so it sways a little, which is rather disconcerting at first, but the views are lovely, either towards the sea and the gardens or towards Marina Bay Sands and the city.
Loved the opportunity to get a different view of the super trees and other areas of the Marina Bay. This is well run and not overcrowded so you don‚Äôt have to wait ages to get some good photos.
Enjoyed this so much as when you get up you can see so much and looking down on the Gardens is very beautiful especially just on dusk. Enjoyed this immensely

One of the most impressive attractions in Singapore is of course the Super Trees. To make the most of this experience I highly recommend to go up to the Skywalk between the trees. It costs 8 Sinapore dollars and definately worth the money. If your timing is well planned you can even experience the the light and sound show in the evening from the skywalk. The view is a heaven for photographers.

For $8pp, it is an affordable way to have a gain a panorama of the giant trees up close. There was this time limit as to how long one can stay on the skyway but we were never hurried along.

We were here close to sunset and the views on a clear day gave a beautiful hue. Can only imagine being here at 8-9pm when the trees come to "live" with a blaze of colours and music.

I brought the tickets in advance to avoid one que with a risk of cancellation if it rained and was closed. Tickets last a month and I returned on a clear night. Street style food van pull the crowd to the lawn to watch the light and sound show. Wheelchair stroller access to the top is easy by the up and down lifts. The view was spectacular with the changing colours and light timed to the big band and swing music.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great to do at sunset but otherwise a bit boring
REVIEW_BODY: Started the skywalk before sunset and it was average. Didn't really have any impact. As the sunset though the change was incredible. The best photo opportunities were from where you initially take the lift up to the skywalk. As you progress along the skywalk the opportunities for photos aren't as spectacular. A must do at sunset.
Great way to be amongst "the trees". Have done this on two occasions but hard to take good photos as it sways - but that part of the fun

I am Italian, totally trustworthy and well travelled.
Awesome. Go there two times: one staying up the skyway at the sunset enjoing from above the light and sound show, the other enjoying the same show lining down at the ground looking up.
It is a must: go there.
You can go up for experience. But don't be too excited, As I feel it is underwhelming. Stay up there and get as much photos as possible

This skyway offers amazing views of supertree grove, Marina bay Sands hotel, Singapore skyline and beyond, even to the port.
I went on it in day time, it is 8$ per person ticket. In evening, you may have a huge waiting time, even an hour or so. So I covered this in the day.
It would take around 15 mins considering all the photos you want to take once on the skyway. Otherwise it's a small walk.

The OCBC Skyway gives you a beautiful view over the gardens, the Flyer, Flower Dome and Cloud Forest ,only shame is that you can spend only 15 minutes on the skyway, as only 70 people are allowed at a time.

We timed this just right as got to be up there during the musical lighting show at 8.45pm. Absolutely stunning, well worth the additional ticket price (although would recommend pre booking online to get a better discount!) The only downside is we were ushered to hurry up by the staff member on duty as they closed at 9, but when you‚Äôre watching such a beautiful show you want to savour the moment!

This is optional when visiting the Gardens in the bay, good views but if you are thinking of going on the Singapore Flyer or the observation deck at Marina Bay Sands these offer far better views.
You are only allowed 15 minutes to walk round (its a one way system) but we did it in much less time.
Great place for a walk around. Can really get some good photos to brag to ya mates back in ya home town.
The Skyway is beautiful. But if it rains they usually close it. But one can talk a walk along the skyway, we need to purchase tickets
It's a short walk above ground between the trees. You need a ticket to get up. Spectacular, but the trees are beautiful from the ground too.
We were only in Singapore for 5 days, it is worth doing, but not the first thing to do. The views are great on a clear day, one needs a head for heights, a bit expensive to go up.

REVIEW_TITLE: Spectacular - but very busy at night
REVIEW_BODY:
A suspended walkway through the Supertree Grove. Gives great views of the ‚Äòtrees‚Äô and surrounding areas. S$8 to go round, but lots of queues for both tickets and to get up. Open 09:00 - 21:00, but last admission is 20:30. There‚Äôs an amazing light show nightly at 19:45 and 20:45, but to be honest, if you‚Äôre not up by the start of the first show you probably won‚Äôt get up.

During the day it‚Äôs a lot less busy.

Me and my girlfriend loved it up there, you get 15 minutes and it‚Äôs not too crowded at all, great views and even though they told us an hour wait it wasn‚Äôt even half an hour! Would highly recommend

Visited here with my boyfriend after reading so many good reviews and recommendations and it was definitely worth it! The views are stunning and make for lovely photos/videos. It says that it accommodates for up to 50 people at one time, however I don‚Äôt think there was that many when we was there which made it easier for photos. The queue said it was an hour wait, but it wasn‚Äôt even half an hour which was a pleasant surprise. The only downside is that you only get 15 minutes, however I suppose if it‚Äôs not too busy and you can get your photos done then you don‚Äôt need much more than 15 minutes anyway. Not too badly priced either, we did it at around 7pm, but it looked nice when the lights were on at around 8pm so that might be a nice time to try it too!

REVIEW_TITLE: Unique, futuristic take on outdoor garden spaces
REVIEW_BODY:
I forgot to count how many of the garden towers there were but I think there are between 10 and 12 them. One is quite a bit taller than all the others as it contains a restaurant just below the top level which h itself boasts and open air bar with panoramic views of the gardens, downtown Singapore Nd the Marina Bay Sands hotel.

The towers are deceptively large and a number of them are interconnected with a series of elevated walkways suspended by steel guy ropes. All in all, a one of a kind magical space.

This is a paid entry but worth every penny .. we were not expecting big heights but this was actually at some height ... avoid the sun and try the activity in the evening .. it is much more fun with all the lights around you ..

REVIEW_TITLE: Sadly closed and no info on when it would reopen
REVIEW_BODY: I completely understand they need to close in rain. However, there was no signage about this (we had to get through the stupidly long ticket line to find that out) and we were rudely dismissed when trying to find out more details - like if it might open again that afternoon, what time it opens the following day etc. So, it‚Äôs 1 star for us as we didn‚Äôt even get to try it!!
Be here exactly during sunset and you will get some amazing views of Singapore! The walk itself is kinda short but it is totally worth it. I recommend!

This place is awesome to take some good photos with the gardens in the background or the marina bay hotel. The gardens really offers great scenery and the OCBC bridge offers a great view. 8 SGD to go up the sky way but the gardens are free.

After looking around the gardens at ground level it was worthwhile seeing the gardens from a different perspective. We were there before 11am on a weekday so didn't have to wait in line. Definitely worth a visit and to see the trees close up.
Enjoyed being able to see above the Gardens by the Bay. Walkway uncovered, so not recommended in middle of day or when raining. Nice photo opportunities.

REVIEW_TITLE: Get there early for night viewing
REVIEW_BODY: Attempted to go to the skyway at 7:15pm, but wait times was already 50 minutes so had to pass. Looks spectacular, but if you want to be on the walkway during the Super Tree Grove light show at 7:45 or 8:45, you really have to plan ahead. I don't think you can buy for specific times so a bit of a gamble. Cash only.
Not too pricey, limited to 15 mins. Great views of the gardens and surrounding buildings. Really great for photos

Ocbc skyway is located in the gardens by the bay which is located in the heart of singapore. Super tree Grove which are large vertical garden tower is connected by a huge bridge and the skywalk is allowed on the top of it. We can have a better lighted up view of the city if you are taking this at night. The light and sound show in the super tree Grove will also be a nice experience once you are viewing it from the skywalk. Altogether it's a nice place to visit on your trip to singapore.
Make sure you go up the skyway the views of the gardens and the city are amazing can get some lovely photos and long memories
Definitely worth the wait on tickets and queue. Lift to go up and down. Nice way to see the garden and have a closer look at the trees.

There is a ticket to go up.8 sing$ . When you go up the view is amazing. There is a lightshow every day 19.45 and 20.45. To reach this take mrt to bayfront station and through marina bay sands you will arrive at the gardens by bridge.

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent walk to do at sunset
REVIEW_BODY: At 8 SGD a person the skyway was definitely worth it. You get great views of the gardens, domes and hotel. Would definitely recommend

While in the Marina Bay gardens this is worthwhile doing, it's only a 15 / 20 minute experience but the views are great and at nighttime all of the trees light up. The pics show you what it looks like. Cost was 16SGD each.

In a park of beautiful trees, airconditioned green houses this is the dumbest thing! Unless you are desperate for a view of the skyline. The one from Marina Bay Sands Shopping Centre's upper open space is free!

REVIEW_TITLE: Garden Rhapsody at night- a must see
REVIEW_BODY: Twice a night at 7.45 and 8.45 the OCBC Skway gets transformed into this sound and light show which is most spectacular! There is no charge to see this outstanding presentation! Highly recommended.

Every aspect of gardens by the bay is amazing. We decided to climb and walk the bridge too. Best time to go is just before sunset and stay until after, you'll get to see it in all its beauty. Very scenic and you'll get to see things in a different way nwar and far.

REVIEW_TITLE: It's ok but wouldn't bother again
REVIEW_BODY: The walkway is quite short - approx 400 mts and does give good views of the lovely park. But that's about it and for $8 per person it's a bit of just alright.

This is my 2nd visit to the OCBC skyway and ia amazingly surprised how different I feel compared with my last trip.

I went at about 7 pm. So was able to view the daylight scene of the area. When night falls, the tree lights up. The skyline changes. All lighted up. Then at about 7,30pm, the highlight began. There is a musical tree performance. Wow, non wonder there are so many people lying on the floor watching the performance. I was lucky to get to the lift and reach the treetop at about 7.25pm. So was able to see the Singapore's skyline before it became dark and witness the changes when the lights are lighted up. So romantic.
Truly recommend for 1st time visitors to Singapore and also suggest you visit at about 7pm and at the same time to catch the musical tree show. Otherwise, you will miss a lot from here.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best views in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Walking between the giant SuperTrees along a walkway, the views are amazing of Marina Sands hotel and the city skyline. The plants have grown up the sides of the SuperTrees, as well as air plants which are tied into place.

The price for this attraction is S$8 per person, walkway is reached by a lift running up the centre of the first SuperTree. The walkway then sweeps from one tree to the next, in a curve and at times a little narrow.

Well worth a visit, if you are in Singapore.

Walking the high hanging bridge from one super-tree to another was an amazing experience. It was both fun, and the view of the entire Marina bay and the rest of the Gardens by the bay - was simply superb.

REVIEW_TITLE: Bird‚Äôs eye view of the Garden‚Ä¶.
REVIEW_BODY:
Having seen a David Attenborough programme at home about the colonisation of these structures by urban wildlife ‚Äì we were intrigued

Entrance cost a reasonable price ‚Äì limited numbers allowed at any one time ‚Äì so timing is key ‚Äì the day before the wait in line was given as an hour+ ‚Äì so we declined ‚Äì came back the next day at an earlier time and it was 20 minutes which was a lot less in reality ‚Äì lift to the Skyway

You are quite high and with perforated walkways ‚Äì not for those who don‚Äôt like heights ‚Äì but you are rewarded with a succession of views of the Garden and beyond ‚Äì going down the stairs as an alternative to the lift and you can look inside the structure and see how the plants are secured which in itself is a bonus

Well worth the experience ‚Äì thank you
We waited until the night time so we could go walking along the skyway. Entry is limited and was very busy. There are Christmas lights atm and markets which makes this very interesting.

REVIEW_TITLE: The best thing to do in Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must-do and it only costs $8 pp. You go up by lift, 32m high and get a great view of downtown Singapore. They say that you only get 15 mins up there but I don't think anyone is keeping time so no rush.

Beautiful stunning view from this amazing place. After buying the ticket, you may have to wait a bit longer in the queue to go up on the skyway but it's worth waiting. Try to visit in the evening. You will walk from one tree to another tree and you have approx 20-25 min to see the beautiful singapore from this place. After getting down,sit relax in the garden and enjoy light and sound show which is a must see.

The entrance fee is SGD 5. Worth for experiencing walk on 22 metres above the ground. But if the weather is not good eg: rain, windy, better give up, because the management team quite strict and you are not allow to stay too long there. And since it's only a short walk and can't enjoy the view, rushed. I was a little bit disappointed though

We have been to Singapore few times and have finally made a trip to see these wonderful Supertree Grove. This is definitely something very different and worth seeing up close. The structures are incredible and the view from the Skyway is amazing. Be aware that you do not need to buy a ticket for the actual gardens to visit the skyway. We were told to purchase the ticket initially and only after visiting realised that we actually never needed it, and had to ask for a refund. It was very cheeky of the ticket office to force us to spend $46 and then buy additional tickets for the skyway. Needless to say, we were not impressed about that. But the experience of the Supertrees is worth it and will only take an hour or so unless you want to explore the rest of the gardens.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good if you aren't afraid of heights
REVIEW_BODY: Good if you aren't afraid of heights. I wouldn't pay full price for it. I got it very cheap as part of a package deal, which made it worth it.

REVIEW_TITLE: $8 entry, 10 minutes needed, and can have long queues
REVIEW_BODY:
You can only buy tickets to the Skyway from the kiosk near the Skyway itself (I tried to buy tickets from the other ticket counters in Gardens by the Bay but they send you to the Skyway area to buy tickets from one ticket booth).

I visited at night at around 7:20pm and they were handing out tickets for the 9:20pm time slot, even though they‚Äôre supposed to close at 9pm and last entry is advertised as 8:40pm (20 minute time slot intervals).

And there was a long line queueing to get tickets as well.

So I decided to go back the next morning and see if the queues were better first thing in the morning. Fortunately, there was no queue in the morning. $8 entry, and it will only take you 10 minutes to take in the view from the Skyway, meander very slowly along the Skyway and then exit. It‚Äôs a very short Skyway.

Note: Buying a ticket does not necessarily provide you with immediate access to the Skyway. It buys you a ticket to the Skyway, and then you have to be issued with a time slot to enter. First thing in the morning, I was able to go up straightaway. During busy periods, you may have to wait 2 hours for your time slot.

The views are good, and it‚Äôs worth it for the price.
It is the skywalk along the super tree with 360 degree view of Singapore. This is one of the must in Singapore.

At 8 SG dollars, it‚Äôs a short walk from one tree to another, but the view is spectacular. Not as high as the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, but the height makes you feel like you are among nature and the trees.

I went before it got dark since I wanted to take pictures at sunset, but seeing the super trees from the viewing platform by the hotel is equally spectacular and you can save the 8 SG dollars
This is a must see if your in Singapore. Its a brilliant structure with an amazing lighting show. Recommended

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful Views of Gardens at the Bay and City
REVIEW_BODY:
The Skywalk is on the 57 floor of the Marina Bay Sands.

I was on my own but both times getting in the lift the attendants were happy for me to wait for other visitors as do not like lifts.

Once up there, the views are wonderful, and also you can get a good overview of the Gardens.

Being a guest of the hotel, I was able to go to the Infinity Pool whilst I was up there.

REVIEW_TITLE: The view is amazing! Combine it with the music and lights show
REVIEW_BODY: The wait time can be a bit long. And it closes by 9 so have to be a bit early in the evening. But everything is worth it as the view is superb and to enjoy the music and lights show can be a worthwhile experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not as good as the domes
REVIEW_BODY: I wouldn't bother doing this again, it is nice to walk around up there but nothing that special, at night there are massive queues and you have to book a time slot if you want to go up after 6. I viewed the light show from down below and it was excellent, no need to view it from up there

There is nothing better than being high up walking through trees, and having great views of this beautiful city! The Skyway combines the best of everything and is quite relaxing.

I was surprised that there weren't more people on it at a time, but I certainly am glad because I was able to take in the views as well as taking a bunch of pictures! Day or night this is a great attraction to visit in Singapore. It isn't the longest attraction and I was done each time within 15-20 minutes. However, as long as it isn't packed there is no time limit so you can stay as long as you'd like!

I recommend buying the Friends of the Garden pass. This is their membership and allows you to visit all three attractions as many times as you want for an entire year!

This is a must-do while in Singapore. If you are staying at Marina Bay Sands it is only a 5-10 minute walk over the bridge and then to here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun to walk Along! Over Really quickly
REVIEW_BODY: Not for those with fear of heights for sure. At times I could feel the skyway swaying but getting in those good photo ops and seeing the view of Singapore from that high up (the Flyer can probably give you a better view) was great!

If you have a fear of heights it might be fearing, if not it is stunning. It connects a few futuristic artificial trees where you can see the landscape and the bay around. A lift brings you up and down and it costs SGD 8. It is really worth to do it, highly recommend it. Most of the people don‚Äôt want to pay the fee, so it is never overcrowded.
Very crowded on this skyway. Very beautiful view. Worth for money. Don't go above if you fear about height.

REVIEW_TITLE: BEAUTIFUL DESIGN WITH SOME GREAT VIEWS
REVIEW_BODY: A perfect way to stroll over to the MBS or waterfront area. They have numerous little view points ideal for taking those great selfies. Plan to take some time and enjoy the views. I have to think that it would be spectacular at night

Nice view, but the entrance is not for free. If you're in Singapore for a very short trip might worth it, but if you're staying a bit longer you can see much better views from other places without having to pay for it. Also the Skyway path is quite short and you can stay upstairs only for 15 min.

REVIEW_TITLE: Aky way between super trees building in Gardens by The Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
if you have additional spare of 8 SGD and not afraid of high, buy ticket and go up to OCBC sky way.
It stands only meters from the ground and in my opinion didn'y give me any experience at all.
Fun to try yet nothing special for this sky way.

Good. Nice views. Interesting area to look at and I like what they have done. $8 to get in. I didn‚Äôt spend much time up there. The walkway has some movement in it so if you don‚Äôt like heights... it‚Äôs can get a little bouncy.
I dont know actualy what that but from far looking so colorfull and pretty here near to river and singapore lion park.. you can took a lot beatiful pictures when is night
This is my first time coming up here. I often go to Flower Dome and and Cloud forest. I paid 8 sgd and its quite worth it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent view of the Gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: It costs you 8 SGD to go on the top and have a walk on the skyway. This is sort of a bridge connecting the supergroove trees. You can have a good view of the Marina bay sands, gardens by the bay here. Just take enough water with you here as you might get easily dehydrated in the open space here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Another interesting dimension to the Super Trees
REVIEW_BODY: The Super Trees are amazing to look at from the ground, but you get a completely different view on this elevated walkway. Also nice to take in views of the Domes, the Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, and the bay etc through the artificial limbs of the Super Trees. Entry fee is cheap, although you can't stay up there for long.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great viewing platform for the Gardens
REVIEW_BODY: The OCBC Skyway is a great viewing platform for the Supertree Grove and the skyline of Singapore. Reasonably priced at S$8 for adults, the ticket price is well worth it. I recommend observing the weather conditions before going on the skyway to get clear blue skies where possible. Do note, during poor weather conditions, the Skyway is closed to ensure the safety of visitors.
Loved seeing views at night from here .Just before I saw the light show at 7.45 .If you afraid heights and those mobility might struggle as its swaying bridge and high up
This is just a bridge between the artificial trees. Nice view when up there, but the ticket quite expensive $8. This my second time (my first time ticket just $5). The trees also colorful at night.

On an Personal Level i feel the supertree should have been bigger so that this OCBC skyway could have given us a good bird eye view of the Gardens but having said that the it gives a nice view and feel one can have good look at the marina bay sands, Singapore flyer, Singapore River, the Domes . and the Supertree properly.. Its a must try for sure ..

A good skyway in the Supertree Grove with amazing views of Marina Bay Sands and the surrounds. A great place for photos. Height was just nice, I got used to it pretty quickly. Went during the day but it was still amazing. The walk from the Bayfront MRT station took me about 7-8 minutes - the path was well signposted and it takes you over the Dragonfly Bridge too. Note that visitors are allowed only 15 minutes on the skyway.

It is one of the iconic sights of Singapore and must do's on anyones visit here. If you are using the MRT subway BAYFRONT station. which is on the CIRLE LINE. From the MRT there is a 5-7 minute walk to the attraction. Most of this is undercover with AC.

To do the whole site (lakes/gardens/skywalk/domes) and enjoy this would take at least 1/2 a day to complete. Especially if you have children with you.

Once you reach Gardens by the Bay, the main lakes, outside gardens and communal areas are free entry however the Skyway charges S$8 per adult and S$5 per child (3-12yrs). The Skyway is accessed from the ground level by a lift for entry and exit.

They do restrict access to the Skywalk if there is heavy rain or thunderstorms or if they are extremely busy. You get a great view of the Gardens, Dome and Singapore Skyline from the walkway‚Ä¶ Great opportunities to take a few selfies so forget the camera.

Would strongly recommend taking water with you however, if you forget there are a few outlets selling water, ice creams etc‚Ä¶ priced reasonably.

If you are at the attractions in the evening or want to return there they do a nightly light show at 19;45 / 20:45.

Access to the famous domes is an additional charge..

If you are passing through Gardens by the Bay then you are most likely going to see the Supertree Grove and the OCBC Skyway. It is definitely paying the $S 8 and waiting in line for some minutes.

The walkway provides some amazing views across Marina Bay. The visits are limited to 15 minutes per group to ensure that the walkway isn't crowded and everyone gets an opportunity.

If you can visit during the Garden Rhapsody which plays at 7.45pm and 8.45pm each day and you won't regret it. The light and sound show is truly memorable. You don't want to skip this attraction while in Singapore.

You can visit the attraction by coming via Marina Bay Sands or taking the MRT to Bayfron and its a quick walk to the attraction.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice views over the gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: I came up here for the first time recently, having purchased an annual Gardens By The Bay pass. It's quite an impressive design with good views out over the gardens. I imagine it can get very busy at peak times and it seems there is some kind of crowd control in place to restrict the numbers. During the day on a weekday, however, was no problem at all.
If you want to go there at night better buy tickets before 8pm. Later it can be closed. Views from above are really nice

This is an open air walkway between two of the supertrees. The cost is SGD$8 which is quite reasonable (in my opinion) as Singapore is not really a cheap place but in terms of value for money, this might not be the highest rated attraction as it is literally a walkway between two supertrees. The walkway narrows as you walk towards the middle and then broadens out. The "sides" of the walkway come up to waist height so there may be a concern in terms of safety for younger children or those who are taller and have a higher center of gravity. There is a lift that takes you up and another lift (at the other end of the walkway) which takes you down - there are also stairs.
The views which is the raison d'etre for this attraction are not mindblowing. They are very good and I would recommend this attraction most definitely, but don't expect to see much more than the Gardens. The view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel is slap bang in your face and the flyer is over to one side, but this is really as much as was viewable. I went up during the afternoon and so may be the real attraction is in the evening the lights in the Super Tree Grove are twinkling.
Definitely something to see but I wouldn't go out of your way for it. Therefore only gets 4 rather than the full 5 from me.

Don't buy the ticket at the ticketing office (near Bayfront MRT) as sometimes they refuse to sell if it is cloudy outside. Instead buy them at the ticket desk below the skyway. It costs 8 SGD and it is worth it. Bring a camera, and you will find yourself amused with the view provided.

PS: Try to allocate two visits, morning and night one (around 7-8PM). They have some light shows around that time.

I do hate high but I felt so comfortable with this site worth the $SGD8.00 The view is spectacular but kid should not be permitted at least teenagers I find it that it could be dangerous for young kids

I visited this place on the weekday afternoon to avoid the crowd compared to the weekends. I would recommend to visit this place during sunset time so it is not too hot and you can see better sky. The price has gone up from before, now is $8 for adult and $5 for child. You are limited to a 15-min visit at the bridge. The staff will remind you to go down when the time is up. It's reasonable as they have a limit on how many people can be on the bridge.
OCBC Skyway is really nice and worth if you are visiting it during evening. Best is to plan during the Light and sound show. You get to see the show from TOP which is a different experience.
Give yourself plenty of time and wander at leisure. Helpful guides are everywhere to happily give advice as to what to see and where to go, well worth going back at night for the lights.
Nice attraction, worth staying for the light show. This is shown every night and combines lights and music.

The light show was free and fantastic. A lot of people were there but there is lots of room. Took a bunch of pictures and movies. Excellent matching of the lights to the changing music. go see it if you have a chance.
bring your guests from overseas and they will surely be impressed by this attraction in Singapore. its everything what Singapore is.. advanced, beautiful, but very artificial...

REVIEW_TITLE: Definitetly worth checking out in Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
Within the Super Tree Grove in the Gardens by the Bay is a skyway (walkway) connecting a few of the Super Trees. The Skyway is suspended from the Trees themselves.

There is a separate cost for this, currently $8SD for adults. You take the elevator up in the center of one of the trees then walk on the Skyway taking as many photos as you can and then take another elevator down a different Tree.

From the Skyway, you can see the entire Marina Bay and you will have killer views of the iconic Marina Bay Sands property, as well as the domes and gardens of Gardens by the Bay. Plus you can see all the other trees in the Super Tree Grove up close and personal.

The Skyway has room for a few people across for most of it, but gets thinner in the middle portion. It is not solid and has a little sway to it, I wanted to mention that in case you might be slightly afraid of heights, still worth checking out, completely safe too. Great great photo ops everywhere. Lots of people but they kind of regulate the number of people there is seems. They post only 15 minutes max viewing time, but there is no-one there checking this out at all.

I loved seeing this walkway, it, to me, is part of the very coolest part of a very cool park/Garden which only makes it a bigger smash. Seeing the Trees and Grove is free, the walkway has a little expense, but is so well worth it.

Don't miss it, make sure your phone/camera has lots of battery life left as you will be taking lots of photos for sure.

An easy walk from the MTR also.
Amazing architecture and the light show is pretty cool as well. Great views looking back on to marina bay sands building as well. Felt like something from Avatar

REVIEW_TITLE: Went Up During The Light Show
REVIEW_BODY:
By the time I was done visiting the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest, it was time to head to the OCBC Skyway. At first, I didn't saw anyone on the skyway from the ground. After finding the entrance, I found out that it was closed for a few hours earlier due to the rainy weather.

Since at the time I was there, the rain had stop and the authorities was just about to re-opened it. I was practically the first group to go up and avoid the long queue. When I was about to get up, there was a light show going on. So by the time I was up on the skyway, I was able to witness the light-show with no obstruction and it was very clear.

I'm glad that I didn't miss out on the opportunity to get up. Although, it might not be the best for anyone who is afraid of heights.
About 130 m long aerial walkway 25 m from the ground . Offers awesome scenic views of Singapore & Gardens by the bay

If you visit the super tree grove then you must go up the sky way. It's a wonderful experience. The view is spectacular from up there. However, they won't let you stay up for very long. Do not miss this experience
There are few skywalks in s'pore and ocbc skywalk is one of them.the view is stunning(suitable for those people who mot scared of heights)

We did the skyway by day but think it would be pretty special at night. Great views of the park and the city and up close to the trees. My friend struggles with heights and as there is some movement and it is quite narrow in parts, she really strugged. Costs S$8 each

Pretty nice place. Just need a few minutes to see it however since it is not very extensive, but pleasant nevertheless. We got a ticket for this as part of a combo ticket, so not sure the actual cost, but certainly worth a few dollars to see. We went in the day, and were pleased, but I think it would be great in day or night. Really nice, but very small. Given how iconic it is for Singapore I would say it is a must see. and it is beautiful at night.

Must have taken about 100 pictures of this, it started to rain a little whilst there but it certainly did not but a dampener on the evening. One thing though, prepare for a long walk back to your hotel because getting a taxi when everyone else is leaving is a nightmare
Lovely views of the gardens there‚Äôs a lift to the top and it‚Äôs easy to walk around it‚Äôs also wheelchair friendly.
If you have the patience to queue, come on over here. Its like a bluckbuster movie for real! So much people on the weekend just to walk up in the sky!

When you go to Marina Bay, you know there are certain landmarks to tick off your list: Marina Bay Sands SkyPark, Gardens by the Bay and the SuperGrove. Purchasing $8SG tickets to the skyway check one of those activities off and is well worth your time. Being up in the canopy offers a cool breeze and the views of Gardens by the Bay are excellent. It's great to get up close and personal to these living solar trees. One of our group was nervous about this adventure of heights, but she was able and happy to traverse the suspension bridge between the two super trees. It's a short experience, it's not particularly strenuous, but it's an affordable and beautiful attraction.

REVIEW_TITLE: A close look at the Supergrove trees
REVIEW_BODY: You can inspect how the Supergrove trees are made, the plants attached to them, the amazing horticulture involved. Plus the beautiful views, of course.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great photos for the not so weak-kneed
REVIEW_BODY: we actually bought a [cheaper] bundled ticket for ocbc skyway and the gardens via klook and we were not disappointed. it has a great view for pictures like the marina bay sands hotel, the singapore flyer, etc. and if you can get the timing right, you can watch the light show from the ocbc skyway.

REVIEW_TITLE: An amazing experience - a must when visiting Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This was a wonderful experience and a must. My personal preference is going at night. Less people and the lights amazing!
I think this something that every visitor to Singapore must do. Please bear in mind that there is a limit on the Skyway and that the tickets are only sold until a certain hour.
This is one place to visit at night especially with the family to catch the amaising light show they put on...LOVED IT!
The OCBC skyway and super tree dome is truly amazing. It costs $8 to walk the skyway and I would thoroughly recommend doing it for the amazing views. There was no queue for ticketing or the lift.
This was a wonderful light show, You show watch from the ground then go up into the skyway and look around - it's lovely
Simple walkway between two groves, a different experience. An option to take few good selfies, but feel It can be made more attractive

This short walk through Supertree Grove has great views. Limited to 15 minutes on the skyway but worth the $8. You get an up close look at how the plants are growing on these enormous amazing structures!
The bridge is quite short but offer a good view of the surrounding. I prefer the night viewing because of the light and it is cooler.
lovely elevated view of the surrounding gardens. be prepared for queues if going during peak periods.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic Views of Supertree Grove and Singopore Skyline
REVIEW_BODY:
The Supertree Grove is absolutely incredible and it is well worth the few quid to go up to the skyway to get a bird's eye view of the city with its skyscrapers and Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The views of thec waterfront and bay are fantastic too.
But most of all you get a great view of the Supertrees themselves and the beautiful flowers and shrubs in the vertical gardens.
It is such a unique place and fshrytale-like in its magical otherworldliness.
No steps by the way, it's a lift up and down. The skyway is not very long and the staff tell you that you have a maximum of 15 minhtes up thete, but try to drag your feet and stay up a bit longer!

You should choose appropriate time for enjoying both sunset and light show while standing right on the walk. Note that the walk may take 15-20 mins since you need to save time for other visitors behind you. Amazing night view!!!

The walk amongst the top of the Supertrees is worthwhile. Even though you only have 15mins there are plenty of photo opportunities and the view over the park and the skyline is amazing. The Skyway is open between 9.00am and 9.00pm daily so if you want to get that evening view you can certainly do so.
Take in the views of the park from the skyway. And if you go at night you get the impressive light display. Very impressive.

REVIEW_TITLE: Arguably the best view in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
When we visited Gardens by the Bay, it's not on our plan to go to OCBC Skyway. We were content by just taking pictures below. But spur of the moment decision we bought a ticket. And we were not disappointed. One of our best purchases for SG$8!

The view is way more spectacular than what you see below. And our pictures look more Instagram-worthy!

Last closing counter is at 8pm, but sometimes they close an hour earlier if the queue waiting hour is longer than hour.Be there by 8pm to witness musical light show.Please take the shuttle for $3 because the park is huge.

REVIEW_TITLE: Marina Bay Sands and Flyer view
REVIEW_BODY: The OCBC Skyway is located inside the Gardens by the Bay, connecting two Supertrees. You have to pay to get inside the lift, but it is not very expensive. At the top, you have a great view of Singapore and also of the trees, with a more detailed perception of the top.

Visited Garden By The Bay on Sunday. The nearest MRT will be Bayfront station.

Arrived at 7.30pm. The park around the Skyway and Supertree were filled with people. Everyone anxiously awaiting the nightly lights show at 7.45pm. The show is about 15 minutes. Different song theme each night. The songs played are hot favourites of different time, really turned back the clock to this days. The light shows run by the song. Really interesting.

Enjoyed the short display. Worth thinking and remembering.

It's not expensive to walk the skyway and the experience is very enjoyable. For those suffering height issues it might not be suitable for them. The walk is well enclosed so safety is not an issue. It was a very pleasant stroll along the walk and to take in the sights of Singapore from a different perspective. I found the whole experience enjoyable and peaceful. It is an attraction I would recommend to anyone visiting Singapore.
